text: 8) But the documentary has just reaffirmed my view that there is no Theranos content I will not eagerly consume. And now I am going to go outside, @jdawsey1. -30-
author: AshleyRParker

text: 7) At one point, @MichaelCBender sneakily handed me our baby, post  , so it’s possible I missed a few key scenes.
author: AshleyRParker

text: 6) I do feel bad for the reporters who wrote huge profiles of Elizabeth Holmes and totally missed the story. That’s every journalist’s nightmare.
author: AshleyRParker

text: 5) The MC Hammer “U Can’t Touch This” dance scene is as good as promised. BUT... I probably look like that when I dance. So.
author: AshleyRParker

text: Not yet...
author: AshleyRParker

text: Yup.
author: AshleyRParker

text: 4) Tyler Schultz is a wonderfully compelling and charismatic whistle blower, and I would love a whole profile just on him.
author: AshleyRParker

text: 3) Entering the Great Elizabeth Holmes Deep Baritone Voice Debate... If you’re going to fake your voice, why would you make yourself sound SO awkward, almost as if your throat is clogged with Drano?
author: AshleyRParker

text: 2) The quotes used in the @NewYorker profile of Elizabeth Holmes don’t actually match the audio on the reporter’s digital recorder. It’s just a few dropped words, BUT STILL. What about those fabled fact-checkers?!
author: AshleyRParker

text: 1) In childhood pictures, Elizabeth Holmes has dark brown eyes. Now, her (bloodshot) bright blue eyes are one of the constants mentioned in every profile — and striking in the documentary. Really good color contacts??
author: AshleyRParker

text: Waiting for call backs, I’m watching HBO’s “The Inventor” about Theranos and Elizabeth Holmes. A few real-time, random thoughts...
author: AshleyRParker

text: Then they’re missing out on potential lede ideas...
author: AshleyRParker

text: Mueller’s probe became the ominous elevator music of Trump’s presidency — ever-present, always thrumming, invariably haunting. My latest w @PhilipRucker + @jdawsey1 on a combative Trump awaiting the findings, and how his team did (and didn’t) prepare.
author: AshleyRParker

text: BREAKING: Mueller has submitted his report to Attorney General William Barr, signaling the end of the Russia investigation. Check back at the Washington Post for the latest updates.
author: AshleyRParker

text: "News coverage has become background noise, like a sea that periodically surges and retreats." As we await the Mueller report, here is a lovely, lyrical read by @ScottShaneNYT.
author: AshleyRParker

text: What about: C) In an angry panic that you have arrived only four hours before your flight? Asking for my dad.
author: AshleyRParker

text: Mueller’s gonna just rest his eyes for a minute and then see if there are any Thin Mints still left in the freezer...
author: AshleyRParker

text: As I presciently — if impractically, at the time — predicted!
author: AshleyRParker

text: I will take your unblinking, golden-haired, evil Silicon Valley name twin, and raise you a shaggy-haired, dumbly sweet boy band idol. https://www.nytimes.com/2007/05/13/fashion/13angel.html … Cc: @NYTnickc
author: AshleyRParker

text: Lima, Ohio — “You better love me! I keep this place open!” Trump says, taking the stage as the crowd cheers a General Dynamics manufacturing plant here.
author: AshleyRParker

text: Dammit!
author: AshleyRParker

text: Thank you, Mr. Irene Jefferson.
author: AshleyRParker

text: Also, why is it considered the ultimate insult to call a man “Mr. [Insert Wife’s Name Here]”?

text: “Unsuccessful.”
author: AshleyRParker

author: AshleyRParker

text: You buy one bear suit — one! — and suddenly your email is all Carter’s, OshKosh and Hanna Andersson spam.
author: AshleyRParker

text: After the New Zealand shooting, the White House briefly considered hosting a round table featuring persecuted religious minorities — Christians, Jews, and Muslims. But ultimately, @jdawsey1 and I report, they didn’t think they could mobilize it in time.
author: AshleyRParker

text: In the weekend after the New Zealand massacre, Trump averaged more than a Tweet per hour — but none about the shooting. Instead, he spent most of the time holed up at the White House, calling friends to vent and complain about other things. W @jdawsey1. https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/trump-response-to-new-zealand-massacre-highlights-his-combative-history-with-muslims/2019/03/18/bca24248-4996-11e9-93d0-64dbcf38ba41_story.html …
author: AshleyRParker

text: On a sparkling, crisp spring Sunday morning, daffodils and crocuses in bloom, President Trump... tweeted. And tweeted. And tweeted. @agearan on Trump’s Lenten day of grievances.
author: AshleyRParker

text: Pence once stopped a meeting in the Situation Room because he noticed the presidential seal was still hanging on the wall. Out of respect to Trump, he had an aide remove it — then continued the meeting. My latest w @ToluseO. https://wapo.st/2TOBk1y
author: AshleyRParker

text: Pete Buttigieg, the young and openly gay Midwest mayor, finds a voice in crowded Democratic presidential field via @chelsea_janes and @michaelscherer.
author: AshleyRParker

text: In which @PeteButtigieg, who had a good working relationship w Pence in Indiana, tells me and @ToluseO that now in the White House, the VP has either traded his “morality for power,” or “persuaded himself that this is consistent with some divine plan.” https://wapo.st/2TOBk1y
author: AshleyRParker

text: Biden offered Pence the mildest of compliments — conceding he was “a decent man.” That’s when the attacks began. @ToluseO and I on Pence’s unlikely emergence as a bipartisan punching bag.
author: AshleyRParker

text: Trump and Irish leader celebrate their countries’ close ties, but differences over Brexit are evident. By @agearan.
author: AshleyRParker

text: Today's Boeing news is a good excuse to revisit this amazing @mviser story, on the (literal!) crash landing of Trump's airline, the Trump Shuttle.
author: AshleyRParker

text: The NYT also once did this to my story about the Keystone Pipeline vote! At the time, I was super upset... BUT I now realize I should have just viewed it as an (inadvertent) Times Insider sneak peak...
author: AshleyRParker

text: Late to this fun @jbendery piece on Sherrod Brown’s potential likability problem. That voice! Those clothes! The hair!
author: AshleyRParker

text: In private AEI discussion between Cheney and Pence, Cheney worries the Trump administration’s foreign policy “looks a lot more like Barack Obama than Ronald Reagan.” Inside they closed-door conversation, w @costareports.
author: AshleyRParker

text: As Europe worries about Trump, congressional leaders invite NATO head for joint address, by @seungminkim, @rachaelbade + @costareports.
author: AshleyRParker

text: Inside Trump’s massive reelection campaign, complete w 2016 themes — and a 2020 infrastructure. Brought to you by @ToluseO + @jdawsey1.
author: AshleyRParker

text: Trump gave a dizzying, mind-spinning — both fun and funny and dark and grim — speech at CPAC last week...and @PhilipRucker and I spent a dizzying, mind-spinning — fun and funny and dark and grim — last week analyzing all two-plus hours of it. Read it here.
author: AshleyRParker

text: left side hard side
author: AshleyRParker

text: From Fighter to Fabulist, Entertainer to Victim... @PhilipRucker and I unpack the 10 distinct personas of Donald Trump on display during his epic CPAC speech. https://wapo.st/trumpspeech

text: "I don’t feel responsible for the sins of my father and grandfather." @mviser w a close-in look at Biden's tough talk on race.

text: Hard to blame us, really. BUT WHAT IS OUR BAT SIGNAL?! #RamblersUnite
author: AshleyRParker

text: For those curious few: This is my first week back from maternity leave! I'm grateful for the four months I was able to spend w my daughter, and grateful to be back at work. So: Please send tips — sleep; news; etc; — my way...
author: AshleyRParker

text: V excited @hollybdc is joining @washingtonpost as a 2020 national political reporter. Come for the great writing and perspective — stay for the amazing pics.
author: AshleyRParker

text: “Then he just sits up in bed halfway and looks and me and he goes, ‘Shit, I’m not going to see the Mueller report, am I?’ And that was really the last coherent thing that he said.” https://www.npr.org/2019/03/05/700175470/elderly-trump-critics-await-muellers-report-sometimes-until-their-last-breath …
author: AshleyRParker

text: I would just like to the thank the bouncer who, after I forgot my wallet (w ID), finally let me into the bar after, approaching tears, I frantically showed him my baby sleep book and nursing tank top as proof that I was “definitely 21 — and, in fact, of advanced maternal age!”
author: AshleyRParker

author: AshleyRParker

text: I just paid $1.99 to unlock the unlimited “hairdryer” sound on my “Shhh” app, and felt like I’d scored the deal of the month. Up next: Upgrading to unlimited “vacuum” and “combine” for just $.99 more?
author: AshleyRParker

text: Scenes from therapy: Today, in my therapist’s waiting room, a woman eyed me, my stroller, and then gave me an unprompted “It Gets Easier” pep talk. #TwoForThePriceOfOne
author: AshleyRParker

text: Beto here sounds disconcertingly like most women I know on maternity leave...
author: AshleyRParker

text: I *just* ran out of my stash of pilfered mini bottles of Hershey shampoo. After spending most of my life wishing my hair was straight and shiny, it turns out what I apparently pined for is chocolate-orange-scented locks...I will now return to my regularly skeded maternity leave.
author: AshleyRParker

text: For years, a classic Romney holiday conversation: “A mixture of ‘Pass the mashed potatoes’ and ‘Do you think I could be president of the United States?’” Great @mviser read—>
author: AshleyRParker

text: I just pumped, sitting shotgun on the Pennsylvania Turnpike, in the pouring rain, en route to Cleveland for the holidays. I’m basically Rachel McAdams, AMIRITE?!
author: AshleyRParker

text: Baby Yoga, apparently: Me paying $22 to frantically try to feed a crying baby while everyone else does yoga. #namaste
author: AshleyRParker

text: Don’t even joke. I’m so sleep deprived I’ll believe anything.
author: AshleyRParker

text: So, formula basically has its own (less in your face, more passive aggressive) version of cigarettes’ “Smoking Kills” warning...
author: AshleyRParker

text: A must-read, moving @maureendowd column on her odd couple relationship w Bush 41 — along w a bonus anecdote underscoring my official status as the World’s Worst Assistant. https://www.nytimes.com/2018/12/02/opinion/george-hw-bush-maureen-dowd.html …
author: AshleyRParker

text: One of the best parts of covering Jeb — other than covering Jeb! — was reading @jmeacham’s biography of George H. W. Bush.
author: AshleyRParker

text: Today I wrote 11 Thank You notes, and have not (yet) cried once. My work here is done. #newbornlife
author: AshleyRParker
